item.title: Josh add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Josh add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "Excellent!" I cried. "Elementary," said he." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Josh add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Josh add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Until the day when God shall deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is summed up in these two words,-Wait and hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Josh add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "When things go wrong, you'll find they usually go on getting worse for some time; but when things once start going right they often go on getting better and better." -- C.S. Lewis
